subject: Re: [junit] Need to test a method that returns void
msgSnippet: Ok, I m still moving to JUnit4, so I ll show you an example I have with JUnit3: /** * Trying to login with username and password */ public void
messageBody:
Ok, I'm still moving to JUnit4, so I'll show you an example I have with
JUnit3:

/**
* Trying to login with username and password
*/
public void testLoginValidation() throws Exception {
try {
securityHandler.login("pt", "portugiesisch");
fail("Username with 2 characters must not be allowed.");
}
catch (Exception ex) {
// passed :-)
}
try {
securityHandler.login("deutsch", "de");
fail("Password with 2 characters must not be allowed.");
}
catch (Exception ex) {
// passed :-)
}
try {
securityHandler.login("", "");
fail("Blank username and password must not be allowed.");
}
catch (Exception ex) {
// passed :-)
}
}

Please let me know if it's enough.
Tiago

On 4/18/06, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> kotuv wrote:
> > Need to test a method that returns 'void'. Failure of the method is by
> > thorowing an exception. If no exception is thrown it is success.
> >
> > I have wrapped the method call in try...catch and placed
> > Assert.assertTrue(false) statement in the catch block. However even
> > when exception is thrown, this statement is not executed
> > and 'Succeful' message is output.
> >
> > Help appreciated.
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Venkat
> >
> >
>
> can you post your test?
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
